prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 1
Name: Jinxie Tenma
Description: The maid of Kyubi Manor and a friend of Trucy. She thinks I'm a demon.
Character 2
Name: The Amazing Nine-Tails
Description: A masked wrestler of unknown identity and origin. The nine-tailed cape he sports is the signature piece of his costume.
Character 3
Name: Damian Tenma
Description: Jinxie's father and the mayor of Tenma Town. He was found unconscious at the scene of the crime.
Character 4
Name: Rex Kyubi
Description: The deceased alderman of Nine-Tails Vale. His snow-white hair was particularly striking.
Character 5
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!
Character 6
Name: Phineas Filch
Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective investigating the murder in Nine-Tails Vale. He's a self-styled champion of justice and keeper of the peace.
Character 8
Name: Florent L'Belle
Description: Mayor Tenma's aide. He was supposedly in the foyer with Filch at the time of the murder.
Character 9
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A brilliant former defense attorney who is supposed to be in retirement...
Character 10
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. [caption] Tenma Taro has black feathers, yellow talons. He does not wield any weapon. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.
Evidence 2
Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.
Evidence 3
Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.
Evidence 4
Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime.
Evidence 6
Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.
Evidence 7
Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.) A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.
Evidence 8
Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood. [caption] The man in a beige suit is lying on a table with a spear inpaling him. The other man in a green suit is sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 10
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.
Evidence 11
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.
Evidence 12
Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.
Evidence 13
Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster. [caption] At 3 PM, the program is "Temma Town Pro Wrestling". It is circled in red.
Evidence 14
Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.
Evidence 15
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.
Evidence 16
Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.
Evidence 17
Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.
Evidence 18
Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.
Evidence 19
Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.
Evidence 20
Name: Forbidden Chamber Figure → Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Alderman Kyubi was murdered with a spear that had been on the wall.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 1
Testimony: The fingerprints of the defendant, Damian Tenma, were found on the murder weapon.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 2
Testimony: At the time, Alderman Kyubi was asleep from a drug he unwittingly ingested.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mayor Tenma attacked his helpless victim, impaling him like a human shish kebob!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 4
Testimony: But the sudden pain jolted the victim awake, and he grabbed a statue and struck back!
Person: Fulbright

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. So, we need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The goal is to find one pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

First, let me go through the testimonies. Testimony 3 by Fulbright says: "Mayor Tenma attacked his helpless victim, impaling him like a human shish kebob!" The victim here would be Alderman Kyubi, right? According to the autopsy report (Evidence 14), Kyubi was stabbed with a spear, time of death around 3:20 PM, and he was in a drug-induced slumber. So the testimony claims Mayor Tenma impaled Kyubi with a spear. 

Now, looking at Evidence 7: Fox and Demon Statue. The description mentions it was the weapon used to bludgeon the mayor (Damian Tenma). Wait, the mayor was found unconscious, so he was bludgeoned, not the victim. The statue was used to hit the mayor, not the alderman. But Testimony 3 says the mayor attacked the victim (Kyubi) by impaling him with a spear. However, the statue was the weapon that hit the mayor, not the other way around. Also, the autopsy report (Evidence 14) says Kyubi was stabbed with a spear, which matches Testimony 0 by Fulbright that the alderman was murdered with a spear from the wall. 

Wait, Testimony 3 claims Mayor Tenma used the spear to kill Kyubi, but the statue (Evidence 7) was used to bludgeon the mayor. So there's a contradiction here. If the mayor was the one bludgeoned with the statue, then he couldn't have been the one attacking Kyubi with the spear. Additionally, Evidence 9 (Crime Photo) shows the man in a beige suit (probably Kyubi) lying on a table with a spear, and the other in green (mayor) with head blood. The mayor's injury is from the statue, not the spear. So Testimony 3's claim that the mayor attacked with the spear contradicts the evidence that the statue (used on the mayor) was the bludgeoning weapon, and the spear was used on Kyubi. Therefore, Testimony 3's assertion that Mayor Tenma impaled the victim is contradicted by Evidence 7, which shows the statue was used on the mayor, not by him.

{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 3}

response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, first, I need to look through the testimonies and the evidence provided.

The testimonies are from Filch (Testimonies 0 to 3). Let me read each one again:

Testimony 0: Filch says he was on guard duty in the foyer as Mr. Kyubi asked. He was making sure no one could get to the guest (Testimony 1), was in his office keeping watch when the murder happened after 3 PM (Testimony 2), and didn't see anything out of the ordinary (Testimony 3).

Now, looking at the evidence. Evidence 13 is the TV Listings, which mention Filch's TV guide. The program at 3 PM is "Temma Town Pro Wrestling," circled in red. The note says the afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster. 

So Filch claims he was in his office keeping watch after 3 PM when the murder happened. But if he was watching TV at 3 PM (as the circled listing suggests), then he might not have been properly guarding the entrance. That could mean he wasn't paying attention, which contradicts his testimony that he was keeping a good watch. 

Another angle: The murder time was around 3:20 PM (Autopsy Report, Evidence 14). If Filch was watching TV during that time, especially a wrestling match that was a disaster, maybe he was distracted. So his testimony 2 says he was in his office keeping watch, but the TV evidence implies he was watching TV, which might mean he wasn't actually vigilant. Thus, the contradiction is between Filch's Testimony 2 (he was keeping a good watch) and Evidence 13 (TV Listings showing he was watching a program at 3 PM when the murder happened around 3:20 PM). 

Wait, but the TV program starts at 3 PM, and the murder was around 3:20. So if he was watching TV, he might have been distracted during the time of the murder. His testimony says he was keeping a good watch, but the TV listings suggest he was occupied with the wrestling match. That's a contradiction because he couldn't be both watching TV and keeping a proper watch. Therefore, Evidence 13 contradicts Testimony 2 or 3. Let me check the exact testimonies again.

Testimony 2: "I was still in my office keeping a good watch when the murder happened after 3 PM."

Testimony 3: "But I didn't see nothing outta the ordinary, no siree!"

But if he was watching TV (as per Evidence 13's TV Listings with the program circled), then he wasn't keeping a good watch. So the contradiction would be between Evidence 13 (TV Listings) and Testimony 2. But the user says to pick one pair. Alternatively, maybe Testimony 3 where he says he didn't see anything, but if he was distracted by TV, he wouldn't have noticed anything, which might not directly contradict. However, the main contradiction is between his claim of keeping a good watch (Testimony 2) and the TV program he was watching (Evidence 13). Therefore, the correct pair is Evidence 13 and Testimony 2. But let me check the evidence numbers again. Evidence 13 is the TV Listings. Testimony 2 is the third testimony listed (since they start at 0). Wait, the testimonies are numbered 0,1,2,3. So Testimony 2 is the third one: "I was still in my office keeping a good watch when the murder happened after 3 PM." So Evidence 13 (TV Listings) shows he was watching a wrestling match at 3 PM, which would overlap with the murder time (around 3:20 PM). If he was in his office watching TV, he might not have been keeping a proper watch. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 2 (keeping a good watch) and Evidence 13 (distracted by TV). So the answer should be evidence 13 and testimony 2. But let me check if there's another possibility. 

Looking at Evidence 6: Foyer Diagram, which includes Filch's office. If Filch was in his office, which is part of the foyer, but the TV was on, that might be the case. Alternatively, maybe the timeline. The murder was at 3:20 PM. The wrestling program was at 3 PM. If the program was a disaster, perhaps Filch was watching it, which would take his attention away. So his claim to be keeping a good watch is contradicted by the TV program. So the correct pair is Evidence 13 (TV Listings) and Testimony 2. Therefore, the answer is {"evidence": 13, "testimony": 2}.

{"evidence": 13, "testimony": 2}
